statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Ill.-Chicago 52, Loyola of Chicago 51
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Josh Mayo hit a 3-point shot with 9.1 seconds left to give Illinois-Chicago a 52-51 victory over Loyola of Chicago in a Horizon League game Saturday. The loss snapped a seven-game Loyola winning streak. Loyola (20-10, 10-6 Horizon) led 51-44 with two minutes left, but never scored after that. T.J. Gray hit a 3-pointer, and Mayo added a layup with 46 seconds left to cut Loyola's lead to 51-49. The Rambler's Blake Schilb missed a jump shot from the free throw circle with 16 seconds left, and UIC grabbed the rebound to set up Mayo's game-winning shot. Mayo led the Flames (13-17, 7-9 Horizon) with 14 points, while Gray added 13, as both teams shot poorly all night. UIC shot only 36 percent from the field, making 23-of-64, but Loyola hit only 16 of 64 shots for 29.6 percent. The Ramblers failed to make a field goal during a nearly 10-minute stretch of the second half. UIC dominated the boards, grabbing 45 rebounds, including 17 offensive, compared to 36 for Loyola. The Ramblers stayed in the game with free throws, hitting 14 of 16, while the Flames took only two free throws during the game, hitting one. Schilb and J.R. Blount led the Ramblers with 18 points apiece, with Majak Kou adding 10.
